revision.text:
{{about|the Irish television personality|the Welsh criminal|Catherine Lynch}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2015}} {{Use Irish English|date=May 2015}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Katherine Lynch | image = | imagesize = | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Mohill]], [[County Leitrim]], [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] | death_date = | death_place = | medium = Stand-up and television | nationality = [[Republic of Ireland|Irish]] | active = | genre = Satire
sketch | subject = | influences = | influenced = | spouse = | domesticpartner = | notable_work = ''Katherine Lynch's Working Girls''
''Katherine Lynch's Wonderwomen''
''An Audience with Katherine Lynch''
''[[Celebrity Bainisteoir]]''
''Katherine Lynch's Single Ladies'' | signature = | website = | footnotes = | current_members = | past_members = }} '''Katherine Lynch''' (born 1972) is an [[Irish people|Irish]] television personality from [[County Leitrim]]. She has had several television series broadcast on [[RTÉ Two]], with titles like ''Working Girls'', ''Wonderwomen'' and ''Single Ladies''. Lynch also participated as a ''[[Manager (Gaelic games)|bainisteoir]]'' in the second series of the [[RTÉ One]]'s ''[[Celebrity Bainisteoir]]''. She is said to have established a following among the Irish [[Homosexuality|gay community]]. ==Career== Lynch began her career as part of the Irish gay scene. This part of her career included winning Miss Alternative Ireland in 1998 as "Tampy Lillette" (a skit on Country & Western singer Tammy Wynette, with each costume trimmed with tampons. She went on to star as Busty Lycra in her regular Thursday night show in GUBU Bar in her show G Spot, with a variety of guest "artists". Meyler and Lynch adapted their characters for television and produced three shows; ''Katherine Lynch's Working Girls'', ''Katherine Lynch's Wonderwomen'' and ''An Audience with Katherine Lynch''. ''Katherine Lynch's Working Girls'' was her first television series. The three-part series was broadcast on RTÉ Two on Tuesday nights in January 2008. The series featured three of Lynch's characters; Singin' Bernie Walsh, Sheila Sheik and Busty Lycra. The comedian described it as a "hybrid" series, featuring both sketches and interaction with the general public. The ''[[Irish Independent]]'' referred to it as being "in the spirit of the 'comedy of cringe' vein which is so in vogue".{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/entertainment/tv-radio/katherine-lynchs-working-girls-1264602.html|title=Katherine Lynch's Working Girls|newspaper=Irish Independent|date=12 January 2008|accessdate=12 January 2008}} ''Katherine Lynch's Wonderwomen'' began airing on 20 October 2008. It was the first production by WAKA TV, a company established by Lynch and Myler. The six-part series focused on the exploits of four characters, Singin' Bernie Walsh, Sheila Sheik and two new characters, Liz Hurley and Dalkey Dunphy Davenport.[http://www.rte.ie/tv/katherinelynch/about.html "Katherine Lynch's Wonderwomen – About the Show"]. RTÉ. Retrieved 28 April 2009. ''An Audience with Katherine Lynch'' followed this in December 2008, described by ''Irish Independent'' critic John Boland as "an hour-long show in which Katherine Lynch's ego was allowed to run rampant in front of an audience of minor celebrities".{{cite news|first=John|last=Boland|url=http://www.independent.ie/entertainment/tv-radio/rte-comedy-youre-having-a-laugh-1597863.html|title=RTE comedy? You're having a laugh...|newspaper=Irish Independent|date=10 January 2009|accessdate=10 January 2009}} Lynch was a ''bainisteoir'' in the second series of ''Celebrity Bainisteoir'' in 2009. She managed [[Dromahair GAA]] in Leitrim, claiming that the passion she felt for her county was her motivation to take part in the show. Dromahair competed against the [[George Hook]]-managed [[Cuala Casements GAA]] of [[Dalkey]], [[County Dublin]] in the tournament's quarter-final.{{cite news|url=http://www.leitrimobserver.ie/news/celebrity-bainisteoir-katherine-lynch-.4776073.jp|title='Celebrity Bainisteoir' Katherine Lynch to take charge of Dromahair|newspaper=[[Leitrim Observer]]|date=11 December 2008|accessdate=11 December 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150514030239/http://www.leitrimobserver.ie/news/local-news/celebrity-bainisteoir-katherine-lynch-to-take-charge-of-dromahair-1-2032595|archivedate=14 May 2015}} Upon reaching the final, she appeared alongside her opponent [[Derek Davis]] on ''[[Tubridy Tonight]]''.{{cite news|url=http://www.rte.ie/arts/2009/0508/tubridytonight.html|title=Tubridy's Saturday line-up revealed|publisher=RTÉ|date=8 May 2009|accessdate=8 May 2009}} A 2009 DVD outsold efforts by [[Neil Delamere]] and [[PJ Gallagher (comedian)|PJ Gallagher]], though did not manage to outsell [[Des Bishop]].{{cite news|first=Will|last=Hanafin|authorlink=Will Hanafin|url=http://www.independent.ie/lifestyle/stuck-in-the-middle-with-you-2098812.html|title=Stuck in the middle with you|newspaper=[[Sunday Independent (Ireland)|Sunday Independent]]|date=14 March 2010|accessdate=14 March 2010|quote=Katherine Lynch's DVD nearly outsold Des Bishop and easily outperformed Neil Delamere's and PJ Gallagher's DVDs.}} Her series ''Katherine Lynch's Single Ladies'' began in January 2010, achieving a 29 per cent audience share for its first episode which featured nudity and an encounter with footballer [[Cristiano Ronaldo]].{{cite news|first=Lorna|last=Nolan|url=http://www.herald.ie/entertainment/around-town/i-almost-broke-law-to-nab-ron-says-katherine-2015445.html|title=I almost broke law to nab Ron, says Katherine|newspaper=[[Evening Herald]]|date=15 January 2010|accessdate=15 January 2010}} Lynch appeared on ''[[List of The Cafe episodes|The Cafe]]'' on 8 January 2010 before the show began in order to promote it.{{cite news|url=http://www.rte.ie/arts/2010/0108/thecafe.html|title=The Café's guests announced|publisher=RTÉ|date=8 January 2010|accessdate=8 January 2010}} ==Characters== Lynch is known for her multiplicity of characters and her confusion over which one is her personal favourite. When asked by the ''[[Irish Independent]]'' which was her favourite she initially declared it was "like asking a woman to pick her favourite child" but when prompted chose [[Liz Hurley]], described as a "sexually confused small-town girl of 35 who still lives at home with the Mammy, coaches the local ladies' GAA team, plays [[Bass (instrument)|bass]] in small-town [[AC/DC]] Tribute act 50-50". Lynch's other characters include a resurrected version of eighty-foot supermodel Busty Lycra, portrayed as a [[Foot fetishism|foot fetish]] model and [[Pornographic actor|porn star]] from [[Northern Ireland]] who returns from [[Los Angeles]] when her career is destroyed by a [[Plantar wart|verucca]] in her own foot. When Lynch walked down Dublin's Thomas Street in the guise of Busty Lycra, she was stopped on many occasions by people asking for her identity, with some people believing she was [[Mr Pussy]]. Lycra featured in ''Working Girls'' but was removed from ''Wonderwomen'' amidst concerns about perceived rudeness expressed by RTÉ. According to the ''RTÉ Guide'', Bernie Walsh—another of Lynch's creations—is her favourite character. Walsh is a country and western singer with an album, ''Friends in Hi Aces'', featuring songs such as "Start Packin' the Van ([[Dundalk|Dundalk, Dundalk]])", "My Van" and "Stand By Your Van", to sell. Sheila Sheik is a female [[Belly dance|bellydancer]] from [[Tallaght]], [[County Dublin]], with an [[Egypt]]ian husband. Dalkey Dunphy Davenport is a teenage [[blog]]ger from [[Ballsbridge]] who streams live online from her hotel suite in Dublin. Dunphy Davenport is described as "the [[Peaches Geldof]]-obsessed mall rat with the orange perma-tan, the fluorescent smile, the 3 inch false eye-lashes and the thousand [[euro]] handbag who... 'ooooh my gawd is just loike soooooooo booooored!'". ==Personal life== Lynch is from [[Mohill]] in [[County Leitrim]]. Claimed repeatedly to have been "nurtured by [[drag queen]]s". Lynch's father is from [[County Kerry]] and she has a strong GAA background, with former [[Kerry GAA|Kerry]] footballer and manager [[Páidí Ó Sé]] being one of her cousins. Persistent rumours fuelled by the ''[[RTÉ Guide]]''{{cite news|url=http://www.rteguide.ie/2008/0114/thehotshow.html|title=The Lynch Mob|work=[[RTÉ Guide]]|date=14 January 2008|accessdate=14 January 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080116190608/http://www.rteguide.ie/2008/0114/thehotshow.html|archivedate=16 January 2008|df=dmy-all}} had her as granddaughter of the acclaimed Irish poet [[Patrick Kavanagh]].{{cite news|first=John|last=Malone|url=http://www.independent.ie/entertainment/news-gossip/the-quick-question-katherine-lynch-1502769.html|title=The quick question: Katherine Lynch|newspaper=Irish Independent|date=18 October 2008|accessdate=18 October 2008}}[http://www.rte.ie/tv/celebritybainisteoir/biogs.html "Na Bainisteoirí/ The Managers"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150302223703/http://www.rte.ie/tv/celebritybainisteoir/biogs.html |date= 2 March 2015 }}. RTÉ. Retrieved 28 April 2009.[http://www.rte.ie/tv/katherinelynch/katherinelynch.html "Katherine Lynch"]. RTÉ. Retrieved 28 April 2009. Revelations concerning her links to the [[Marxism|Marxist]] revolutionary [[Che Guevara]] were also discussed on [[RTÉ Radio 1]] by songwriter, [[Shay Healy]].{{cite news|first=Quentin|last=Fottrell|authorlink=Quentin Fottrell|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/weekend/2009/0425/1224245347122.html|title=A new world of flatpack jobs instead of fat cat cars|work=[[The Irish Times]]|date=25 April 2009|accessdate=25 April 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150514030538/http://www.irishtimes.com/news/a-new-world-of-flatpack-jobs-instead-of-fat-cat-cars-1.753603|archivedate=14 May 2015}} This comes about through her connections to the [[Galway|Galwegian]] [[Patrick Lynch (Argentina)|Patrick Lynch]] and his relatives who also include the naval officer [[Patricio Lynch]], and the writers [[Benito Lynch]] and [[Adolfo Bioy Casares]]. Lynch currently resides in Kilmainham. Long-term friends, who include the singer [[Brian Kennedy (singer)|Brian Kennedy]] and the television presenter [[Brendan Courtney]], often visit to watch her television shows with her. Lynch's preferred radio station is [[RTÉ lyric fm]], which she listens to for its music. Lynch describes herself as "a bit minimalistic as regards possessions", donating most of her music collection (which included [[Adam Ant]] and [[Alison Moyet]]) to [[Oxfam]] when she moved house.{{cite news|first=Jackie|last=Hayden|url=http://www.hotpress.com/archive/5088392.html|title=At Home with Katherine Lynch|work=[[Hot Press]]|date=11 December 2008|accessdate=11 December 2008}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * Television series: [http://www.rte.ie/tv/katherinelynch/about.html ''Katherine Lynch's Wonderwomen''] [http://www.rte.ie/tv/katherinelynch/ ''An Audience with Katherine Lynch''] [http://www.rte.ie/tv/celebritybainisteoir/index.html ''Celebrity Bainisteoir''] {{Celebrity Bainisteoir}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lynch, Katherine}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:20th-century Irish people]] [[Category:21st-century Irish people]] [[Category:Irish women comedians]] [[Category:People from County Leitrim]] [[Category:RTÉ television presenters]] [[Category:1962 births]]
